Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: winifred711
Reviews.Content: The apartments were well set out but not much good if you are a light sleeper we were on the 6th floor & the noise from the street & night club near buy was very loud.Some of our group stayed up on higher floors & they did not hear it. The room smelt a little smoky as you could smoke on the balcony & the smell has obviously drifted in but after leaving the doors open for a bit the smell went away.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...well done Quest”
Reviews.Author: christine h
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Quest World Square...what a delightful experience. Apartments are equipped with everything you could possibly need, clean, modern and comfortable. Front desk staff, couldnt do enough to assist. Good swimming pool and gym. Nice touch...Easter weekend, everyone came home to a chocolate bunny in their apartment. Well done Quest World Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Kimal07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in March 2012. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very well equipted and clean. Hotel is very close to all public transport. We had a balcony that did not have a view but was still very nice to have. Despite the CBD location we found the hotel rather quiet and were able to sleep easily. Would definateley stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Your Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: midwicket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in February 2012. The Quest is close to restaurants, Chinatown, movie theatres, grocery stores etc. It is in a very busy part of the city. Quest apartments are all about practicality and not glitter. Reception staff are helpful. Carparking is difficult if you arrive late in the night as there aren't many. Rooms are of a decent size. I stayed in a studio style and a separate bedroom style. Beds were nice and comfy. Unit seemed clean. The kitchen was very good and had all things you need. Bathrooms were large. Could not hear any noise from outside on the street, so they've done a good job with sound proofing. However, as in all hotels, people seem to love to slam doors as they go out in the morning, waking you with a jolt. All in all, if you want a practical hotel without pomp and ceremony, the Quest World Square would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a base for short visit”
Reviews.Author: Caroline Q
Reviews.Content: reasonably located, near darling harbour and world square but accommodation is lacking in respect of terrace ( unusable because of noise from mech and elec plant), poor views and restricted accommodation size

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dorian_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Quest World Square on Saturday night 18th February. We had booked a Studio 2 months earlier because it advertised a King Sized bed. When we checked in we had been upgraded to a one bedroom or should a say 'alcove' as it couldn't be classed as a bedroom. The King bed that we had booked had turned into a Double bed. Not even a Queen which would have been acceptable. We were only staying a night so really had no need for a kitchen or living area. Just wanted a decent bed. In fact the bed was so hard as well as being so small that we had almost no sleep. The alcove was so small you couldn't even put one, let alone two bedside tables next to the bed. The light in the bedroom alcove did also not work, or the phone in the room. After complaining we were offered a bottle of wine and were also given free parking which we did appreciate but it still didn't make up for the bed. Considering what we paid for the room. Other wise the apartment was okay. Not sure we would stay again though. Too misleading

Reviews.Title: “Good value apartment in Sydney's China town area with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GarranTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom, serviced, executive apartment on the fourth floor of Quest World Square on 3 and 4 February 2012. The apartment was made of two one-bedroom apartments that were connected. Each apartment had its own bathroom and kitchenette. The kitchenette, while small, was well-equipped with dishwasher, oven, stovetop and large fridge. A Coles supermarket is located across the road at the World Square complex. Some of the fittings in the room were worn and in need of some tlc, but overall were fine. In the evenings, as we walked from the lift to our apartment,there were cooking smells eminating from a chinese restaurant on the ground level of the building. However, the smell wasn't noticeable in our room. The staff were quite helpful. About an hour after we checked in on the first night, a staff member rang as a courtesy to make sure everything was OK. We had been having difficulty operating the air-conditioner and she was able to resolve the problem for us. On our last day, another staff member extended our check-out by half-an-hour (a longer extension wasn't possible as they were fully booked that evening). Given the location and facilities of the apartment, the cost represented good value.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Location”
Reviews.Author: Phil B
Reviews.Content: The title says it all! Quest World Square is within walking distance of many of the things I ever want to do when I visit Sydney - the main one being good Asian food. The fact that you often spend more time waiting to cross George St than you do with actual walking to get to Chinatown means it's essentially on your door step. It's also close to Central train station plus monorail and tram stops - no more than 10 minutes walk to either. But the location is only part of it. The staff are friendly and very helpful with no fuss when, during the booking process, I had to make changes on a few occasions as I was booking on behalf of other people who's plans changed a couple of times. The same can be said for when we arrived early and asked to leave our bags until we could check in. So quality of service was first rate. The rooms were quite spacious, very clean and as quiet as you could expect for the area. Our small balcony overlooked a laneway which was hardly impressive, however this sort of thing can't be considered a down side considering you're right in the middle of the city. If you want a view of the Opera House or Harbour Bridge then you'll need to pay a hell of a lot more than you do at Quest - which was very reasonably priced considering the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dbth2
Reviews.Content: Great room with balcony. Suggest requesting one of the triangle shaped studios. Clean spacious and modern. Enjoyed our one night relax and proximity to Chinatown etc. Nice hotel. Not a world beater.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: RodeStofzuiger
Reviews.Content: Sydney is a very lively city. Because of this I requested a room that was as high as possible, to try and escape the street noise. I was very happy that this request was fulfilled. The carpark is a very awkward shape, like a triangular ramp. With my 4WD, it made it awkward going down and parking, but it was still possible. However our overall experience was poor. We stayed there one night. After needing an early night after the Chinese New Year festivities, at 12:30am we were awoken by the emergency alarm telling us to evacuate immediately. Not knowing what was going on, we tried to look for the emergency stairs to evacuate but could not find them. We went back to our room to call reception and ask whether it was safe to use the elevator, but there was no telephone in our room! God forbid there was a fire! Naturally, the receptionist was flat out trying to find out what was going on. The ordeal had taken an hour and we were back in our room. Apparently it was a false alarm. The next morning, we did not receive an apology for the interruption. No recognition whatsoever. An apology is all I wanted. As someone who works in customer service, I was appalled by this. To management, train your staff in customer service. If you call yourself a 4.5 star establishment, then you should live up to this expectation. One of our lights did not turn off, the TV did not turn on initially and I found some hair (not the head type!) in our bed. However the view we got was ok, the bathroom was clean and the advice we received was decent. But unfortunately due to our emergency ordeal and realizing what a hazard our room was, I can only pick on the negatives. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach infested”
Reviews.Author: HereOnHols
Reviews.Content: We checked in a little after midnight on 25/26 Jan. The apartment seemed very clean and well presented. However, it wasn't: unfortunately there was a small cockroach running across the table. Then, after hesitating (maybe it was just one cockroach, lost?) we saw another running across the headboard of the bed. On moving the pillows, we discovered cockroach faeces and/ or dirt. A scattering of it. The gentleman on reception (Brent) confirmed these points by visiting the room with us. He offered us another room but, given it was small cockroaches in the rooms, I believed the problem to be with an infestation in the building rather than a lapse in housekeeping. I asked for a refund, which (after a phone call from Brent to the supervisor) was refused. As it had been a long day and it was then close to one am, we left and went in search of another hotel. A few days later, a representative of Quest rang me to offer a 50% discount on my next stay. I said I had asked for a refund, and was told I would be called straight back. I am still waiting for the callback. I would not recommend this property as I believe the building to have a cockroach problem, and I see I am not the first reviewer to encounter this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Quest For Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: peciacake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quest World Square for three nights in January 2012 in an apartment that was two self contained units sharing a common entrance. As a couple and two friends it was ideal: we had a king size double bed while they had single beds in the other apartment. Otherwise the units were identical with a kitchenette, bathroom with shower only and inside the bathroom a large closet c/w washing machine, dryer and ironing board. Not having a bath was about the only shortcoming - the rest of the apartment(s) were a treat with good quality appliances such as the dishwasher, microwave and HD TV. Having a fully stocked fridge was also a blessing upon arrival, particularly after wasting over 30 minutes gaining access to the car park due to a fault with the machine that programs the access cards. It was about the only gripe we had though as the rooms were clean and comfortable and great to relax in after a day's sightseeing around Sydney's Darling Harbour and China Town precincts. Given Quest World Square is so close to China Town it was no surprise to discover what is probably Sydney's best Asian supermarket within the World Square complex across the road. We were able to stock up with plenty of good quality Chinese food, putting the kitchenette to good use. Not that there was any shortage of good Asian restaurants nearby - we were within 10 minutes walk of Sydney's best Asian eating experiences. The Gym is a major disappointment with two treadmills and five other aging pieces of exercise equipment - recommended only for the dedicated Gym goers who need a daily fix. The lap pool is a treat though - not over-chlorinated as is often the case with hotel pools and a water temperature that makes it easy to do as many laps as you like. After booking through Wotif we were expecting it to be straightforward to check out - everything apart from parking @ AUD$40.00 per day and minibar usage was pre-paid. The problem being no one told the receptionist. After charging the entire account to our credit card, she suddenly realised it was pre-paid. More time wasted when the schedule was already pretty tight - an early morning flight should have been made with time to spare due to the airport being less than 20 minutes away. Due to her oversight though we made it with only minutes to spare after having to reverse the transactions and then re-bill the mini bar and parking costs. All in all though we'd definitely recommend it as a base to explore Sydney from. Not only were we blessed with some magnificent weather, we were also able to relax in a clean comfortable apartment for AUD$80.00 per head in peak season. So for us it's the stand out in our ongoing quest for value, comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: surfy j
Reviews.Content: recently stayed here and my initial thought when walking towards the door was " oh this looks kinda crap" only due to its side lane location. but once inside the staff were very friendly and helpful. the room was a good size and clean. one down side was we were told on the phone a few days earlier that the portable baby cot we ordered would be there and it was not when we got to the room. we rang reception and they said sorry and the cot was there in under 5 mins. good location in between pitt and george street which both lead to circular quay (20 min walk roughly) or 10-15 mins to darling harbor. there is also plenty of buses near the hotel. the pool as nice and clean and never busy. even on the 28dg day. tv was a bit small, no foxtel and the bed was really firm. but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JaneyR69
Reviews.Content: Studio unit was OK, quite spacious, well equipped. The staff are variable, with some being more helpful than others. They are fairly disorganised, after checking in I discovered the room wasn't ready and was being cleaned. Its a good location, close to everything. The gym is pathetic - large room with a few bits of dying equipment in and asthmatic aircon giving a sauna-type effect. Overall you can do much better for your money in Sydney, and I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACH INFESTED”
Reviews.Author: carpediem333
Reviews.Content: Travelers beware, this hotel is ROACH infested. I saw something crawling on the kitchen floor, so I went to have a better look around 11pm. To my disgust it was a large cockroach. But thatâ€™s not the end of it. After turning on the kitchen light, I was horrified to find 20 or so baby cockroaches crawling across the counters. DO NOT STAY HERE. Obviously, I donâ€™t have to go into the health aspects of sanitation... BUT IT DOES NOT STOP THEREâ€¦. when I went to complain to reception to ask to be changed to a new room â€“ THEY REFUSED ME. They said there was nothing they could do and they could not switch rooms. (Mind you I had the standard apartment where the bed is right next to the kitchen (no divider or anything)â€¦Shaking, crying, and having a panic attack I asked â€“ â€œSo youâ€™re telling me I have to sleep on the street or sleep with a room full of cockroaches?â€� Reception: â€œYes.â€� â€¦Finally after much debate (and another phone call to some mystery manager), they reluctantly (and with attitude) moved us to a new room. After my partner asked how a room just magically became available, the front desk clerk replied, â€œI donâ€™t know, I just work here.â€� WORST Customer service EVER. Oh and donâ€™t expect a king size bedâ€¦instead itâ€™s two beds pushed together with a king size sheet over it...Iâ€™ve slept in hostels that were cleaner and had better facilities. YOUâ€™VE BEEN WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Quest World Square”
Reviews.Author: Ricki T
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice apartments at this place. Took a while to find the place and the parking is not that good, but everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but too noisey”
Reviews.Author: grandad57
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick no tourist info given reception efficient but not welcoming. Room good standard it was clean although there was a red wine stain on our sheets but the sheets had been laundered. It was just a shame housekeeping overlooked this. You are right on the junction of two major roads and there is a busy pub too. Sleep quality was poor which spoilt it for us. On the positive nice clean good size pool

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should get its act together”
Reviews.Author: georgieandthree
Reviews.Content: The main problem with this hotel is incompetence; while the staff were mostly friendly the group with which I travelled had no end of trouble with them getting our booking right. For my own room, I phoned to change it from a king bed to twin beds with rollaway. They emailed me a confirmation; 2 hrs later they emailed me another one back to the original king bed! They also did not want to honour a promotional rate. I had to phone (at STD rates) again to change the booking to the 3 beds. Assured it was ok. When I arrived, guess what, the room was made up with a king bed. This happened to a number of rooms within my group, with one lot of ppl asking upon check-in for it to be fixed, assured it would be, then returning to the room 8 hrs later at 11pm to find it hadn't been done!! The night receptionist & maintenance person had to change the beds and they didn't even have the correct linen. Secondly, what was billed as a "one bedroom apartment" was, in my opinion, a studio. The bedroom section was not closed off from the "living area" and was only just big enough for the bed. If the bedroom is not separate, it's a studio! The living area was about half the size of what is pictured in the hotel's photos. From seeing other apartments our group had, there seem to be two different sizes of 1-brm apartment, this needs to be made clear upon booking as we would not have tried to squeeze 3 ppl in the smaller one. My bed was comfortable, the room was clean and the kitchen was well-equipped. There was something wrong with the water pressure in the kitchen as the tap always spat at us; also the tap water was dirty (possibly a Sydney thing but in that case it would have been nice to have a jug of filtered water or at least more than 2x600mL bottles in the mini-bar). The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaMaree81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Quest Wold Square in Sydney for 6 nights in September 2011. We found the staff to be pleasant. We were in a one bedroom studio apartment on the 7th floor. You get a typical inner-city view across to office blocks from the balcony. The kitchen was fairly well equipped to make a decent meal. The decor was simple and quite modern. The gym had a very big floorspace (with 2 treadmills, a vibration machine, a rowing machine, no exercise bike) and the pool was a decent size. If you are coming in to the hotel, it's easier to do this from Goulburn Street, as Cunningham Street is like a back alleyway. It is a lot less noisy here than if you stayed on George Street or Pitt Street. However, being so close to the centre of Sydney, you do tend to hear ambulance/police sirens a few times each night. Quest World Square is a very good place to stay if you are in Sydney longer than just the weekend. Because it is a serviced apartment, it has a kitchen and a combined washing machine/dryer. You can go food shopping at the Coles, which is literally across the road. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Sydney Entertainment Centre, and it also doesn't take long to get to Darling Harbour. I would recommend you get on the 555 tourist bus if you want to go to Circular Quay or the main area of the city. We walked back to the apartment from the Opera House (with me in heels) and it took about 30-40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Walleroobie
Reviews.Content: The apartment my wife and I used was very good for our Sydney stay....relatively close to CBD and business offices for me. Apartment had a King Bed (two beds joined together), bathroom, laundry, kitchenette and lounge/desk area...all small as one might expect but adequate for our needs. Reception staff were especially helpful and checked on our welfare about an hour after we had settled in (haven't encountered that before!). Compact packaged breakfasts (extra charge) were very good and you are in Sydney CBD with 100's of alternative breakfast venues very close by. It is very important to note that car parking is extra - unfortunately not mentioned in any of the communications I had. There is little to critise here but in the interest of finding something to assist the Quest to improve I would recommend - 1. New towels...the current towels would probably serve well as a tea-towels in a restaurant. 2. Show carparking costs in your material. 3. Re-stock the breakfast packages for each day of the stay, not just the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location but very unpolished”
Reviews.Author: SilviaKeddie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazingly big for a hotel located in the centre of any big city, especially Sydney. There was good space in bathroom, kitchen, and bedroom areas. It's centrally located as well, not a lovely street but you'll be within walking distance to any main locations and attractions. The lack of details and polishing in the room was certainly below average for a hotel that claims to be 4.5 stars. Dirty walls, broken shelves in the bedroom and lots of marks and stains in the carpets. Staff was ok, but certainly didn't go out of your way to help. I asked for a taxi and they told me to walk up the road which was a bit surprising.

Reviews.Title: “OK rooms, very noisy, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TenRingShanghai
Reviews.Content: One of the key factors determining whether a hotel is suitable for business is whether you wake up feeling rested enough to hit your day and accomplish everything that you need to tackle. In the case of the Quest, I have to say that this hotel is way off the mark. The location of the hotel is fine, but the proximity to a busy street means that traffic and pedestrian noise is a constant for most of the night. However that was not the main problem during my last visit; the same building houses residential apartment, some of which contain students who seem to like partying at all hours of the night. When I complained to concierge at 3am about the noise coming from directly above me, I was told that I was imagining it! I was flabbergasted! Such appalling customer service! Avoid this hotel if you sleep. period.

Reviews.Title: “Was suprisingly impressed”
Reviews.Author: essendontvl
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sydney every week for work, and the week before I had been at the very below average Quest on Dixon which I would not go back to. So I was surprised how different the Quest World Square was for the same chain. I must however admit I was in a 1 bedroom so do not know what a studio is like. The apartment was very big, almost somewhere you could live. Big full size kitchen with all amenities and a lounge room with seperate dining area. Was so big I almost felt like hosting a dinner party. Location opposite World Square with a big supermarket is perfect. Very tastefully decorated and modern with a balcony too. I would highly recommend for a week if you want to self cater and be well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, shower only downside.”
Reviews.Author: BellaOlive
Reviews.Content: Got this room on a Sunday through wotif for $89. Great room size with balcony, little lounge area with flat screen, kitchen, dining, seperate bedroom with flat screen and clean bathroom. Only downside was the awful shower, like being speared by tiny knifes, avoid looking into the spray lest you lose your eyesight. Fantastic location and nice staff. Nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, good location, somewhat basic”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a weekend and enjoyed the location. The apartment a studio executive was spacious separated bedroom , living area with a good kitchenette if you were inclined to cook ( not us!) and a balcony. The balcony is actually why we booked here- unfortunately we are smokers( yes I know not good) and finding somewhere with a balcony that doesnt cost an arm and a leg in sydney is getting difficult. Reception staff were very good, reception itself is pretty budget looking and the apartment although had pretty much everything we needed was fairly basic- some small points - only a smallish tv in lounge and a small lounge for that matter, no bed side lamps and one of those really annoying showers that just sprays. Other than that happy it was good value

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great value...”
Reviews.Author: sunny_reno
Reviews.Content: Even though the room type/bed arrangement in our 2-bd apt was different than what we were told at booking, everything worked out just fine. The location is super convenient to everywhere (restaurants, transportation, major attractions, etc), and the front desk staff were very friendly. The apt itself wasn't the cleanest in the world, but was equipped very well with necessary supplies. The unit is super spacious and the kitchen is a great choice. Definitely worth the money we paid for and will consider it again when going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but tired”
Reviews.Author: Gbh7777
Reviews.Content: Large aparments but the furniture, fitout and beds are old and tired. Watch out for the king beds - two singles joined together with a very hard ridge down the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable apartment living in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: Comfortable apartment style accommodation is clean, quiet (for a city apartment) spacious and pretty well located. Although situated down a short, slightly dingy lane, the hotel is convenient to Museum or Central stations and many Sydney attractions. Good mainstream and Asian supermarkets are very close @ World Square as are a great range of restaurants. Good cheap meals and great cold beer are just a few doors away at Scruffy Murphy's pub or great Spanish at En Casa just around the corner in Pitt Street. The apartments are well equipped and modern, with the complex being only a year or two old. The hotel also has a pool and gym. Clean & quiet and supported by friendly and efficient staff, my apartment had a full kitchen, laundry, king size bed, work desk and balcony. Overall, a good option, especially if you can get a good deal (I paid $99 for a Sunday night direct from the Quest website)

Reviews.Title: “neat & tidy”
Reviews.Author: MrsDeefer
Reviews.Content: The Quest is a reasonably priced hotel for central Sydney. The kitchen was clean and well laid out, and the rooms were clean and tidy. There was no view from my room at all, just the office building next door. There was a small balcony though, with a table and chairs. My only complaint is the indifferent front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “For the price (relative to Sydney, which is a price class all its own)...”
Reviews.Author: lolocop
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous Sydney hotels at the under $200 price range, this one had to be the best I've stayed in. I have found that in Sydney, the price doesn't equate to the quality - meaning that $400 for a 5 star can still land you in a dated stuffy dirty closet they call a hotel room. At the Quest, the reception was absolutely inapt and the lobby was gross so I braced myself for the worse. But when I got up to the apt, it was spacious, pleasant, and it 'feels' clean at least. It feels like they've tried. It is a bit noisy at night, but you're in the middle of a city, so it is expected. For the price, it's adequate and dare I say, beyond my expectations. For Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent about this one”
Reviews.Author: JauntyJen
Reviews.Content: PROS: The price was good for central Sydney and the kitchen was clean and well laid out. The bathroom was a good size and great pressure in the shower. I asked for a quiet room as high as possible and got the highest they had! Staff walked us up to the road with our suitcases and waved down a taxi for us when we left which was nice touch. Plenty of places to eat nearby and the free circuit bus stop just around the corner. CONS: Only 1 out 2 lifts worked our entire stay so usually a long wait. The bedroom was an odd shape which was a bit disconcerting and it didn't leave room for bedside tables or reading lights - should always be somewhere to leave watches, reading glasses, books etc. We had a lot of trouble with our swipe card not opening the door on the first attempt - turned into a bit of a game to see who could open it on the least number of attempts! Overall, a good choice at a reasonable price for Sydney. Would I stay there again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “I just spent two nights in five star hotels, booked here, and would never go back to the five star!”
Reviews.Author: lindylooWestern
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two night in a five star hotel, two blocks away in Sydney. We checked in an hour ago,(in Quest World Square, Sydney), and now realise what a waste of money we spent at the five star. After one hour, carefully checking everything, every aspect of our apaprtment, I cannot praise our room high enough! Lovely balcony, very comfortable bed, accomodating staff, plenty of room, I actually believe it is cleaner than the five star we stayed at! I also love the clean kitchen items in the cupboards! I have no hesitiation, (now that I have discovered Quest) to recommend to my personal friends, and online friends...Quest! From now on, I know we shall be staying at Quest, great value for our money spent, thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Best nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Cookster007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month for 3 nights for my birthday. 5 mins walk from the train station and very easy to find. Reception staff very friendly and efficient. The lift was modern and very clean. Upon arrival we were very pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. It was very spacious, clean and the furniture was modern and new. The bathroom was very clean and the pressure in the shower was very good. As advertised there wasn't any view but we didnt expect one being right in the centre of the city. The location of the hotel was perfect. 2 min walk to the best Irish pub in town, where we had an amazing night on the Sunday as there was a `turn` on and they were the best Irish pub band we had seen in ages!!!!! All in all we had a great stay and would definitely stay there again. Having stayed in several parts of Sydney, ie The Rocks etc... this location is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ozgirlinnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the accommodation very comfortable. We assume we were in an accessible apartment (Room 508) because there was a hand rail beside the toilet and a ramp up to the bathroom. There was no lid on the toilet and it was very high (a bit tricky with small children) but we were glad to have the extra space. There was also a large bathroom with no lip on the shower but this meant the water went all over the floor. There were no other features to make the room wheelchair friendly so it seemed a bit token to me. For instance the kitchen and vanity required standing but the room suited our needs very well. We had a king bed, sofa bed for miss 3 and cot for master 1 (free of charge). They also supply a baby bath and high chair free on request. The beds were all comfortable and warm. The kitchen was in between the bedroom and lounge where the children slept, It had a decent-sized fridge, and full cooking facilities. We did not find glasses for drinking but there we so many cupboards, we got tired of looking. The large bench space was handy. Having that separation between us and them meant we could do things after the children had gone to bed and even stay in the room while our son had his daytime nap. There were lots of places to eat and shop around the apartments and it was a 2 min walk to George Street, a major transport corridor. We thought the location was excellent. We got a good deal by emailing the reception directly and found they were very helpful and accommodating. We only wanted parking for 2 hours and were not charged the $35 parking fee which we greatly appreciated. We would certainly stay here again because it suited us so well. There was enough room for the children to have some fun running around and this is rare at the price we paid in central locations.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible appartment, not accessible”
Reviews.Author: indianpacific1988
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling in a Wheelchair don't stay there. They advertise x 2 accessible appartments. This means the doorways are wide enough to get a wheelchair through and thats where it ends. No shower chair, no hand held shower rose, no hand rails in the shower, no hand rails beside the loo (although 1 very small 1 BEHIND the loo) a full size vanity unit so u cant get to the sink to wash hands or brush teeth from a wheelchair!!! A bed on Wheels!!! An impossible kitchen from a wheelchair. I actually felt very unsafe there.

Reviews.Title: “ok to stay but theres something missing”
Reviews.Author: SugSydney
Reviews.Content: *first stay Aug 2009 the room was ok, odd shape 1 bed room apartment, with bedroom being funny shape to the point where the master bed is bigger than the room, * 2 LCD tv's bonus the smaller one had a yellow line on it, the bigger one had DVD player and stereo, foxtel and unrestricted tv channels made it worthwile, * room is quite compact sofabed will get in the way during night times the room is a funny shape *not much of a view from the balcony only could see street level of Goulburn street, not very high up, noisy saturday night, could be located in the part of the CBD where its riskay, *close to things, the alley where the entry to the apartments is dark and dingy. *the swimming pool is like a bus or train very thin in wdith but very long in length and heated, no poolside furniture to place your towel and the smell of vegatable oil could be smelt from the farside of the pool, pool is quite closely situated to surrounding cafes and bars so allot of cooking smealls can be smelt *the lack of gymanisium equipment not good, * nice modern kitchen.and bathrooms *the first time staying up there was a nightmare i did have lack of sleep maybe because i had to go into work the next day on the sunday or the aircond was not right, the noise from the street and the credit card problem of double charging at check out and claiming that we were wrong and they were right, * we gave this place a second chance and stayed again so on the second time in Jan 2010 our second visit was a good pleasent stay * upon arriving at the hotel we were allowed to store our luggage at reception (we were too early) and we were allowed to use the private bathrooms to change for the concert * upon getting access to our room the first time the was a smell of toliet odour(sewage) we were moved to another room, we were upgraded to the second room which was better the place was full due to saturday night and a hens group not much of a choice of rooms * nothing changed the second time except for a room with a view of Goulburn street, instead of the first room (toilet odour room) view of a construction site, room was similar/exact to the first time we stayed here *Goulburn street and where the apartment is located is in the thick of partyland so expect drunks, allnight doof doof music and sirens

Reviews.Title: “Wow, the best Sydney Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: CitySoul
Reviews.Content: I don't usually bother to write a review about Hotels I've stayed in but Quest World Square has really made a great impression. The room was spacious, clean, modern and quiet and the staff were extremely helpful , polite and even cheerful. If I ever have the opportunity to hit Sydney again I know where I'll be staying... Go Quest !!!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Service at best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DZ_78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Mardi Gras weekend for four nights. The rooms themselves are pretty good neat and tidy. If you want a view though don't expect much as you are right next to another office building. We had a good stay but the thing that really lets this hotel down is the attitude and service provided by the staff. Everything seemed like and effort (even for them to be there) and nothing was actioned with any promptness. I recommend an attitude change in all the staff that work at this hotel. Also the pool isn't heated and don't expect anything from the gym. But other than that a good tay with decent prices and decent sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: Miga_10
Reviews.Content: We planned to go to Sydney and this place was recommended to us. It could not have been a better choice. The rooms were large, superclean and very spacious. I smoke so the balcony was a real plus!!. The reception staff was very frinedly and helpfull. They provieded us with good tips about the city and helped us to book the transport for the concert. On our second night,we needed some help to organise accomodation in Melbourne for my cousin and the receptioninst (a lady) wentout he way to assist us. She even made a couple of calls on our behalf. Thanks !! Over all a great experience. We definetely will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Terrible. It stinks and it stinks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many similar places (chain appartment style accom - quest, merriton, oaks etc etc) but this place is simply the worst ever. There is a noxious odour that is so strong and nasty in the corridor outside my room that I fear that if I have to go out there I will surely not make it to the lift. Even if I did make it to the lift the smell (different to that of the corridor but equally unbearable) I wouldn't have the strength push the button to call it. This place stinks to high heaven! I feel sick from it. I asked the girl at reception what the hell it was and she said it was that the garbage contractor had not collected the garbage for a few days. Charming that the smell could reach up to me on the fifth floor. The tv above the bed hasn't got Foxtel like the one in the living room (which has crap reception). The noise outside is incredible. The shower has great pressure but water leaks out all over the floor and pools in the middle of the bathroom. Not actually at World Square for a start. Entrance via a very dungeon like Cunningham St. Should be demolished and guests refunded. Pure rubbish. Lift your game Quest! You've lost me. I feel sorry for you if you read this and still book to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Top property”
Reviews.Author: Isi1
Reviews.Content: Checked out my self from another nearby hotel. The reception girls was very attentive and informative. The rooms were absolutely great and found extremelly clean and very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “If you like blood”
Reviews.Author: shezz84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quest World Square for 3 nights on a business trip. The cleanliness of the hotel, or lack thereof, is absolutely atrocious. Upon arriving, I found the toilet seat dirty, and stained. I told the reception staff, and luckily this was cleaned up properly. But still, bad impression. Then on the second night, I found huge blotches of dried blood on the quilt. The quilt was covered by a sheet on the top and a sheet on the bottom, no wonder I didn't see it on the first night. But the thought that I had slept in the same quilt still sends shudders down my spine. It was 930pm at night that I discovered this, and I called the reception staff, who changed it for me (seems like there was only one person on duty). It was disgusting and feral. Will never ever stay there again, and will think twice about staying in other Quest establishments around Australia. The hotel is nicely situated, but it's way too noisy to sleep. Very very disappointed. Absolutely will not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable - reccommend”
Reviews.Author: the_perfect_h0liday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quest World Square for 3 nights in July. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment, which was actually 2 x 1 bedroom apartments interconnecting, therefore the accomodation was extremely spacious. The rooms were fully self contained, clean & serviced daily. Everything you need is there, and there is a coles supermarket accross the road. Across the road from the hotel is World Square, which you can get onto the mono rail from & get around the city quite easily. Parking was an extra $35 p/day. Staff were friendly. We would reccommed this property.

Reviews.Title: “Not very wheelchair friendly at all”
Reviews.Author: WheelieTraveler
Reviews.Content: If I wasn't disabled, I would probably award this property four out of five (it would definitely lose a point for the stone cold "heated" pool peppered with cigarette butts and the pool shower that didn't work at all) however, I am writing as a Person with Multiple Sclerosis (PwMS) and am reviewing one of Quest World Square's two "physically challenged" rooms. I assume that this term is an attempt by Quest to be politically correct but I prefer the term "wheelchair friendly". As it turned out, it was perhaps less of a misnomer than I first thought because the room certainly presented me with a number of physical challenges. For the benefit of my fellow wheelies, I must let you know that I have partial use of my legs. When I travel, I use a Pride GoGo Ultra scooter. I can stand for short periods when I have something to lean on or hold onto and I can take a few very slow, wobbly steps as long as I have bilateral support. I travel with my husband, who is also my carer, and our six-year-old son. Anyone who travels and uses a wheelchair or other mobility device will know that you can never, ever trust what you read when booking accommodation so it is imperative that you speak to someone at the property before you make a reservation. The receptionist at Quest assured me that the room was definitely wheelchair friendly with extra wide doors. Together with the knowledge that the Quest web site is a proud partner of MS Australia (shown at the bottom of every page), I stupidly assumed that my idea of wheelchair friendly was the same as Quest's. Here is a list of problems I encountered. 1. There is a very steep, short ramp into the bathroom only just navigable on my scooter. 2. There is a lovely large balcony that was inaccessible to me on the scooter due to a very large lip at the bottom of the door. 3. The grab rails near the toilet are poorly positioned to the side of and behind the pan rather than extending out forwards. 4. It is unlikely that a commode chair would fit over the toilet as it is so close to the wall. 5. There are no grab rails in the shower at all. 6. There is no built-in shower seat or portable shower seat provided. 7. The shower rose is fixed to the wall; I expected to find a hand-held shower on a rail so that I could adjust it easily. 8. None of the taps in the apartment have levers suitable for use by disabled people. 9. The hot water tap in the shower is extremely sensitive; together with the lack of a lever tap, this made it very difficult to adjust the temperature. 10. There is no lip into the shower, which is a good thing, however, the drain is such that the housekeeping staff place two extra towels rolled up across the entrance to the shower to stop the water from running across the entire bathroom floor. 11. The tiles are slippery; even more so when wet. 12. There is no knee space under the basin. 13. The two bins in the apartment are pedal-operated (useless for someone with no or little control of legs and feet). 14. The kitchen is not modified for wheelchair access at all. On this occasion, we were staying in Sydney to attend a wedding. When I discovered that there was no built-in shower chair, I called reception to ask for a portable one, assuming that they must have one. They did not. The receptionist was very helpful and managed to find a plastic chair for me to use, albeit one that was splattered with green paint. With my husband's help, I managed to have a shower (not ideal with the water spraying in my face the whole time) and get ready for the wedding. All's well that ends well I suppose, but I certainly wouldn't recommend Quest to other wheelies and I won't be choosing to stay there again unless the owner/manager substantially modifies their "physically challenged" rooms to bring them up to par. I suggest that they employ an architect who is a specialist in disability issues. Let's hope they do because the staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious, the decor is pleasant and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Consider what you can get for the price”
Reviews.Author: Polli
Reviews.Content: This serviced apartment is located on the edge of Chinatown and across the street from an office building with stores and a food court. It is very urban. It is close to public transportation and the new, free city bus. But it does not feel like a neighborhood (unless you like the ambience of the Irish pub down the block). The units are basic and clean. There were six hangers in the closet and we were two people staying for two and a half weeks, so we asked for more. There weren't more. I asked for recommendations for breakfast in the neighborhood. I was told to go to a nearby street where there were lots of places. Apparently, the desk clerk didn't know the names of any to recommend. Still, here are the good points: excellent lap pool (a bit cold); good security; housekeeping comes most days; some very friendly staff. If you get a good deal on a one bedroom apartment, be sure to ask for a unit ending in "01." There are some supposedly one bedroom units that don't actually have doors on the bedrooms. When I checked in and complained about the lack of a door on the bedroom, the desk clerk actually said NONE of the one bedroom units had doors. Then two days later I found out that wasn't true. The "03" units are large studios. The internet was out for part of the time, which was frustrating. So if you want a kitchen and a laundry in your unit and access to good public transportation, and the price is right, this could work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new apartment hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: I could not flaw this service apartment. It is less than a year old, located in central Sydney. It's 5 minutes walk to Town Hall or Chinatown. The interior are exactly what you would expect in a service apartment: white walls with minimal decoration. It has a nice balcony and good air conditioning. The rate of this hotel can vary by up to 200% depending on the day of the week. Overall it was what I would expect from a brand new Quest apartment hotel. I did not find any flaws.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to use extra bedding don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: AlanShaw
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Melbourne for Mardi Gra weekend as a few very excited young ladies, costumes, false eyelashes and angel wings at the ready; that was until our first nightâ€™s sleep. We booked a one bedroom apartment and paid extra to use the 'fold out bed'. If you need the extra bedding don't bother booking this apartment, I very strongly recommend against it; you can feel the springs in the mattress just by running your hand over it. The girls had an awful sleep and I was just appalled by it; we were compensated with a single blow up mattress that had gone down by the time we arrived back at the apartment and continued to go down after we had someone come up to re-inflate it for us causing me to wake up in the middle of the night and attempt to sleep on the fold out bed â€“ too uncomfortable, then the floor â€“ more comfortable but still had no sleep. To top it all off, when we arrived back after the parade to have a short rest before hitting the town for the night one of the girls injured her back on this disgraceful fold out bed disabling her from walking until the next morning, sounds unbelievable but it happened hence my taking the time to write this bad review. We asked for them to find us a physio to come up and treat her that night and the next morning but there was no outcome to this. Thanks Quest for ruining our highly anticipated weekend, and well done on hiring an arrogant receptionist who rolls her eyes at you when you make a genuine complaint (we were told that the girl was sent home after having an argument with her manager about her bad attitude). We were told that we would receive a refund for the extra bedding charge by the way which I have not seen a cent of; this is the outcome for making a complaint with not only the Manager on duty but the General Manager as well. I will never stay at this apartment again and am strongly advising anyone within earshot of me not to stay there either.

Reviews.Title: “Good serviced apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiPete
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new (opened November 2008) serviced apartment hotel, a pedestrian crossing away from the large World Square complex in Goulburn Street, Sydney. We had a one bedroom apartment, which included a separate King sized bedroom area and full kitchen facilties in an open plan dining room/lounge area. There was an accessible balcony which looked out onto the street below and into a near-by office building (which was deserted at night and during the weekend). The were LCD TV's in both the bedroom and lounge area, with a CD/DVD palyer also in the lounge. The bathroom facilities included a washing machine and clothes dryer, which were easy to use. Our room was available when we checked in early at approx 11am and we were allowed an slightly extended check-out (normally 10am) when we left, even though the hotel was fully booked that night. The hotel is an easy walking distance to the Central and Town Hall train stations and bus services. It's close to Chinatown, with its numerous markets and restaurants, the Sydney Entertainment Centre and Capitol Theatre. There is a Coles supermarket and numerous other shops and restaurants across the road in the World Square shopping complex. We booked directly with the hotel for approx A$200 per night, during the busy Sydney Mardi Gras Parade weekend, when most other Sydney CBD hotels were either fully booked out or much more expensive. We'd be happy to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Quest World Square
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Cunningham Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
